timeline.bodyText: It's interesting that we choose to fail HTTP2 requests to the /query endpoint when the response is being returned, rather than when the request is received. What's the reasoning for this?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: This is because we don't know if the endpoint will return a StreamingOutput (for a print topic or a push query) or just a normal response (for a pull query) until it's been executed. It's just the StreamingOutput (chunked encoding) that's not supported in HTTP2
replies.author: purplefox
